name: Algonquin Provincial Park
description: A massive natural park known for its hiking trails, canoeing routes, and fall colors. It's a prime destination for wildlife viewing.
figureCaption: View of Algonquin Park's forest and lake in early autumn.

name: Santa's Village
address: 1624 Golden Beach Rd, Bracebridge, ON P1L 1W8, Canada
description: A Christmas-themed amusement park with rides, games, and family attractions, perfect for kids and families.
figureCaption: Holiday decorations and rides at Santa’s Village in Bracebridge.

name: Muskoka Steamships & Discovery Centre
address: 275 Steamship Bay Rd, Gravenhurst, ON P1P 1Z9, Canada
description: Explore Muskoka’s boating heritage and cruise the lakes on historic steamships like the RMS Segwun.
figureCaption: Historic steamship docked beside the Discovery Centre in Gravenhurst.

name: Lake Muskoka
description: A large scenic lake popular for boating, fishing, and cottage vacations. Surrounded by charming towns and resorts.
figureCaption: Sunset over Lake Muskoka with boats docked along the shore.

name: Muskoka Brewery
address: 1964 Muskoka Beach Rd, Bracebridge, ON P1P 1R1, Canada
description: Local craft brewery offering a variety of unique beers and a relaxing patio for tasting and tours.
figureCaption: Visitors enjoying the outdoor patio at Muskoka Brewery.

name: Arrowhead Provincial Park
address: 451 Arrowhead Park Rd, Huntsville, ON P1H 2J4, Canada
description: Known for its winter skating trail and summer hiking, Arrowhead is a year-round outdoor adventure spot.
figureCaption: Skaters gliding along the ice trail in Arrowhead Provincial Park.

name: Dorset Scenic Lookout Tower
address: 1191 Dorset Scenic Tower Rd, Dorset, ON P0A 1E0, Canada
description: Climb the 100-foot tower for panoramic views of Muskoka’s lakes and forests, especially stunning in the fall.
figureCaption: Panoramic view from the Dorset Lookout Tower in peak fall colors.

name: Hardy Lake Provincial Park
description: A quiet park with hiking trails, lakeside views, and no motorized boats — perfect for peaceful exploration.
figureCaption: Wooden footbridge and trail alongside Hardy Lake’s shoreline.
